item.description: Expert plant care tips for keeping your houseplants unbothered, moisturized, and happy.

item.title: New pathway engineered into plants lets them suck up more CO₂
item.description: Engineered pathway lets carbon be plugged directly into key metabolic pathways.

item.title: The Plan to Turn the Caribbean’s Glut of Sargassum Into Biofuel
item.description: With record-breaking quantities of the seaweed set to hit Mexico’s beaches, experts propose converting it into biogas and construction materials, as well as using it to underwrite carbon credits.

item.title: The Plan to Turn the Caribbean’s Glut of Sargassum Into Biofuel
item.description: With record-breaking quantities of the seaweed set to hit Mexico’s beaches, experts propose converting it into biogas and construction materials, as well as using it to underwrite carbon credits.

item.title: Science Reveals the Surprising Origins of the Potato
item.description: Potatoes as we know them today are the product of a hybridization that took place 9 million years ago between two plants, one of which was an ancestor of the tomato.

item.title: Best Indoor Garden Systems (2025), Tested and Reviewed
item.description: Grow a backyard’s worth of greens and vegetables in your house with a vertical hydroponic garden. Here are a few that might be worth the investment.

item.title: Lettuce Grow Indoor Farmstand Review: Grow Your Own
item.description: This flashy indoor hydroponic garden is a great way to grow your own greens. Just watch out for bugs.
